title: Often websites in Firefox are pending UNTIL I open the Edge browser
content:
In the last days it often occured that a website that I try to open in Firefox is pending (showing the waiting symbol, see attached image). If I open another tab to access another web site the same thing happens. If I then open the Edge-Browser to see whether it is a problem of Firefox, just in this moment, the websites in Firefox suddnely all appear!

This is not a coincidence. I observed it around 20 times and played around with the time waiting until I opened the Edge browser. I observed it with several kinds of websites (static to web app).

I don't suspect Windows to annoy Firefox, or should I?
creator: eugen.staab

title: How to restore from old firefox folders
content: My PC-Windows 10 crash, I have to reinstall Windows 10 on another partition of HDD. The old windows 10 partition still there with firefox files on that, how can I restore as much as possible from that ?

title: Downloading after OS update

creator: efriedman7420

title: Unable to load "accounts.firefox.com" - regardless of browser - can't Sign in to use Sync as a result - Win11
content:
Hi all, I've got a puzzling problem with just one desktop PC on my network, and only in Windows 11 (fully updated) - the same PC when booted into another OS (Ubuntu) works without any issues.

I have a fresh install of the latest Firefox as well as the Developers Edition. MS Edge is also updated to the latest build, yet none of them can load the "accounts.firefox.com" page.

All I get is a completely blank page, save for a blue circle on the top left corner. I've tried all the usual resetting, Troubleshooting Mode... etc, (issue is present in Troubleshooting Mode) and pretty much stumped at this point.

All other websites I've tested with all browsers don't seem to have any issues at all, including the likes of "accounts.microsoft.com" or "accounts.google.com".

Google hasn't turned up with any results matching exactly what I'm seeing with this particular machine/problem... hoping someone can help pointing me in the right direction.

Thanks in advance,
creator: red2thebones

title: log ins blocked using firefox
content: I cannot log into New York Times via Firefox - ms says it thinks my IP is a bot. Also blocked on a local newspaper Montreal Gazette. I am able to log in w/ no prob on Opera - please advise? thanks!
creator: loucheliferadio

title: After updating to 115.0.1 the devtools language changed from English to Russian.
content:
My firefox installation always run in English with all of its interface elements being in English. One of the recent updates introduced a weird behavior - some of the UI became Russian. I seem to have fixed/bypassed the issue last time it happened https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1415337 but nothing works this time.

Most of my firefox is in English, but some elements such as tab titles in devtools, browser popups "do you want to leave this page", tooltips in this very text form where I'm typing right now - are in Russian for no apparent reason.

I have another profile on this firefox installation and it's completely in English as intended. I tried to check for what changed in about:config, looking for "language" or "locale" string, and there's nothing that stands out. I've tried clearing startup cache, switching language back and forth, restarting firefox.

Any suggestions?
creator: iorickus

title: What does "The Enterprise Policies service is inactive" actually mean?
content: When I type about:policies, I get "The Enterprise Policies service is inactive". I'm trying to validate my configuration against Firefox STIGs which require certain of these policies to be set. So what does this message actually mean? Does it mean no policies are set? Are they set somewhere else? I have Windows Server 2016. Thank you.
creator: mozilla.overbid384

title: Cookie settings ilmoitus jumittaa Firefoxin välilehden
content: Cookie settings ilmoitus jumittaa ilmoituksen sisältävän välilehden. Ilmoitusta ei saa suljetuksi mitenkään. Kyseessä on liitekuvassa näkyvän kaltainen ilmoitus. Sama myös muilla sivustoilla, esim. https://www.cultofmac.com/. Muissa erityyppisissä ilmoituksissa en ole havainnut vastaavaa ilmiötä. Safari-selain toimii normaalisti kyseisen ilmoituksen kanssa.

creator: peter737

title: Cannot use Google sign-in in third-party websites
content:
I recently started experiencing errors for logging into third-party websites that use Google sign-in.

On one site (coches.net), I have the sign-in popup loop for like 3 times and then disappear but leaves me unlogged.

On the other site (etoro.com), the sign-in popup shows but then I get an error message from the site about the login. Then it won't let me reconnect since CloudFlare won't accept my "I'm not a robot" prompt and keeps reloading the same page.

This started happening yesterday. I'm not aware of any Firefox or Anti-Virus updates that have happened since, measures not existing yesterday.

I can sign-in correctly from Chrome with no issues.
creator: m0skit0

title: Confusing error message on a webpage
content:
Hello, 

         I was trying to visit the webpage of the utility company in Florida, www.jea.com and I kept getting the following error message:

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.jea.com. 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

The thing is I had no problem viewing this page on Microsoft Edge or Google Chrome. Any idea as to why I'm only getting this message on your browser?
creator: ERIKKILLMONGER777

title: Issue with Firefox Browser Rendering on Certain Websites
content:
When I visit certain websites, I notice that the web pages do not render correctly in Firefox. The layout appears distorted, images are misplaced, or certain elements are missing altogether. This issue is not consistent across all websites but seems to affect a specific subset.

Steps to Reproduce:

Open the Firefox browser on my Windows 10 machine. Visit the following websites: [List the websites where the issue occurs]. Observe the rendering issues, such as distorted layout, misplaced images, or missing elements. Expected Behavior: I expect the web pages to render correctly get https://apkhomie.com/secrets-of-the-dragon-cafe-mod-apk/, as they do in other browsers such as Chrome or Edge.

Additional Information:

I am using the latest version of Firefox [mention the version number]. I have tried clearing my browser cache and cookies, but the issue persists. I have disabled all extensions and themes, but the problem remains. The issue occurs both in regular browsing mode and in safe mode. The websites in question display correctly in other browsers, ruling out issues with the websites themselves. Can anyone offer insights into why this issue may be occurring and suggest potential solutions? I appreciate any help or guidance in resolving this matter.

Thank you
creator: jaksonflix

title: zoom indicator is back in URL bar
content: When the zoom indicator was introduced in the URL bar, it could be removed with an option in the addon "classicthemerestorer". With a recent update, the indicator is back. How can we remove it now? I can only find information about it from 2017. Firefox is very good, but why are our screens filled up with tools that we cannot remove easily when we don't need them and they are annoying?
